name: Kenya
description: Kenya, a land of dramatic landscapes and vibrant cultures, is located in East Africa. Known as the ‘Safari Capital of the World’, it boasts incredible wildlife, from the iconic Masai Mara to the Amboseli National Park.  Kenya’s diverse geography ranges from the snow-capped Mount Kenya to the arid deserts of the north and the lush highlands. It’s a country of immense beauty, rich history, and a burgeoning tourism industry.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Kenya has a rapidly growing population, contributing to its dynamic social and economic landscape.
quickFacts.detail: The majority of the population resides in urban areas, particularly Nairobi and Mombasa.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Kenya’s vast territory encompasses diverse ecosystems and climates.
quickFacts.detail: It borders Tanzania, Uganda, South Sudan, Ethiopia, and Somalia.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: Nairobi is a bustling metropolis and the economic hub of East Africa.
quickFacts.detail: It’s known for its vibrant arts scene, innovative startups, and wildlife tourism.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: Swahili is the lingua franca, while English is used in government, education, and business.
quickFacts.detail: Kenya’s linguistic diversity reflects its rich history and cultural influences.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The Kenyan Shilling is the official currency.
quickFacts.detail: Exchange rates fluctuate, and it's advisable to check current rates before traveling.

climateData.title: Kenya’s Climate
climateData.description: Kenya experiences a wide range of climates due to its varied topography. The coastal areas are tropical, while the highlands are temperate. The north is arid and semi-arid, and the central highlands have a distinct wet and dry season.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Long Rains
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Characterized by heavy rainfall, particularly in the coastal areas and highlands.  It’s a period of lush vegetation and abundant wildlife.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Short Rains
seasonalCharacteristics.description: A shorter, less intense rainy season, bringing relief after the dry season.  The landscape transforms with vibrant colors.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Dry Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The coolest and driest period, offering the best conditions for wildlife viewing. Temperatures are pleasant, and the skies are clear.

naturalWonders.name: Mount Kenya
naturalWonders.description: Mount Kenya is an extinct shield volcano and the second-highest mountain in Africa. Its snow-capped peaks and diverse ecosystems make it a stunning and challenging destination.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The mountain is home to numerous endemic plant and animal species, including the endangered mountain bongo antelope. Climbing Mount Kenya requires significant preparation and experience.

naturalWonders.name: Masai Mara National Reserve
naturalWonders.description: The Masai Mara is renowned for its spectacular annual wildebeest migration, one of the greatest wildlife spectacles on Earth. It’s a haven for predators and a diverse range of herbivores.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The reserve is located in southwestern Kenya and borders the Serengeti National Park in Tanzania. Witnessing the river crossings is a truly unforgettable experience.

naturalWonders.name: Lake Nakuru National Park
naturalWonders.description: Lake Nakuru is famous for its large flocks of flamingos, which gather on the alkaline waters. It’s also home to rhinos, lions, and other wildlife.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The lake’s water levels fluctuate, impacting the flamingo population. The park is a crucial habitat for endangered black rhinos.

ecosystemData.title: Kenya's Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Kenya’s ecosystems are incredibly diverse, ranging from savannas and grasslands to forests, wetlands, and coral reefs. These ecosystems support a vast array of plant and animal life, contributing significantly to the country’s biodiversity.

biodiversityCategories.name: Savanna Ecosystem
biodiversityCategories.description: The iconic savanna is characterized by grasslands and scattered trees, supporting large herds of herbivores and their predators.

statistics.details: Includes wildebeest, zebras, giraffes, and gazelles
Includes lions, cheetahs, leopards, and hyenas

notableSpecies.name: African Elephant
notableSpecies.significance: Keystone species, crucial for ecosystem health

biodiversityCategories.name: Coastal Ecosystem
biodiversityCategories.description: Kenya’s coastline boasts diverse ecosystems, including coral reefs, mangrove forests, and sandy beaches.

statistics.details: Provides vital coastal protection and habitat

notableSpecies.name: Dugong
notableSpecies.significance: Marine mammal, important for coastal ecosystems

notableSpecies.name: Green Turtle
notableSpecies.significance: Key component of coral reef ecosystems

activities.title: Kenya's Activities
activities.description: Kenya offers a wide range of activities for travelers of all interests and abilities, from wildlife safaris to cultural experiences.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore Kenya’s stunning landscapes on foot, from mountain trails to forest paths.

activities.name: Mount Kenya Hiking
activities.description: Challenge yourself with a trek to the summit of Mount Kenya.
activities.requirements: Good physical fitness, mountaineering experience, appropriate gear

activities.name: Hell's Gate National Park Hiking
activities.description: Hike through dramatic gorges and volcanic landscapes.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy a variety of water activities along Kenya’s coastline and lakes.

activities.name: Diving & Snorkeling
activities.description: Explore the vibrant coral reefs and marine life of the Kenyan coast.

activities.name: Sailing & Windsurfing
activities.description: Catch the wind and sail along the Kenyan coast.

clothing.winter: Warm layers, waterproof jacket, scarf, gloves
